intro: Phlogacanthus changlangensis, commonly known as the Changlang sandalwood, is a rare and endemic tree species native to the eastern Himalayas, specifically found in the state of Arunachal Pradesh in India. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Phlogacanthus changlangensis is considered a vulnerable species facing threats from deforestation and overexploitation.
